issue.title: [jdbc] Upgrade MariaDB JDBC driver to 3.0.8
issue.body:
See https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb-connector-j-release-notes/

This is yet untested (waiting for someone willing).
JAR: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sXgSImDMgCzVfCIzz_idAL8e7XdP4aUr/view?usp=sharing

To test, place this file in the addons directory and rename it to `mariadb-java-client.jar`:
https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/mariadb/jdbc/mariadb-java-client/3.0.8/mariadb-java-client-3.0.8.jar

Related forum thread: https://community.openhab.org/t/jdbc-persistence-with-tableuserealitemnames-and-tableiddigitcount-0/40552/18

comment.body:
This pull request has been mentioned on **openHAB Community**. There might be relevant details there:

https://community.openhab.org/t/jdbc-persistence-with-tableuserealitemnames-and-tableiddigitcount-0/40552/19

issue.title: Add ItemStateUpdatedEvent and enable group channel-links

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: An enhancement or new feature of the Core

issue.body:
There has been some discussion in the past about the `ItemStateEvent` which in some cases may not carry the unit of a value even if the item has a unit (#2956).

This PR adds an `ItemStateUpdatedEvent` which is fired by the item itself (similar to the `ItemStateChangedEvent`. Since the item knows about its dimension and unit, the new event can carry this information even if the unit is derived from a unit provider or the state description. This also clearly separates the events when the item reports something and when the item is supposed to do something:

- `ItemStateEvent` -> the item shall update to the contained state
- `ItemCommandEvent`-> the item receives this command
- `ItemStateUpdatedEvent` -> the item updated the state
- `ItemStateChangedEvent` -> the item changed the state

Since this is rather big change in functionality I would suggest to consider this for OH4 because time is running out for extensive testing (even if unit/integration test coverage is quite good).


As a side-effect group items now also report their state which makes it possible to send aggregated states (AVG/SUM/MIN/MAX/...) to the outside world by using the FOLLOW profile.

comment.body:
This pull request has been mentioned on **openHAB Community**. There might be relevant details there:

https://community.openhab.org/t/habapp-items-some-times-none/140425/11

commits.message:
[systeminfo] dynamic channels (#13562)

* Dynamic channels
* Status messages i8n
* Format fix
* Cache process load values
* Restore channel configs
* Fix test
* Stabilize tests
* Fix CpuLoad1-5-15 update
* Fix test bndrun
* String equals cleanup
* Fix potential null pointer in test

Signed-off-by: Mark Herwege <mark.herwege@telenet.be>

[hdpowerview] Restructure DTO classes (#13630)

* Extract nested DTO's to separate classes
* Rename api to dto
* Move test classes into internal
* Finish moving of files and fix namespaces

Signed-off-by: Jacob Laursen <jacob-github@vindvejr.dk>

[homeconnect] Fix login for simulator environment (#13653)

* Add redirect URI to oAuth request

Signed-off-by: Jonas Brüstel <jonas@bruestel.net>

adopted date parser due to changes in EASEE API (#13654)

Signed-off-by: Alexander Friese <af944580@googlemail.com>

issue.title: [homeconnect] Fix login for simulator environment
issue.body:
The simulated Home Connect environment cannot currently be used (https://developer.home-connect.com/simulator). The test environment always expects a valid "redirect URI", although according to the documentation it is optional.

I reported the bug a few months ago but unfortunately didn't get a reply. That's why I created this pull request.

commits.message:
[lgwebos] Add compatibility note for upgrade to 3.4 (#1419)

Signed-off-by: Laurent Garnier <lg.hc@free.fr>

Some HM devices are using relative humidity (% rH/rF) as units (#13626)

Fix #13553

Signed-off-by: Martin Herbst <develop@mherbst.de>

[mercedesme] Fix unstable ConfigurationTest (#13650)

* Make sure IPv4 is used with default callback URL
* Use a more reasonable timeout

Fixes #13531

Signed-off-by: Wouter Born <github@maindrain.net>

Improve markdown linting (#1906)

* Improve markdownlint configuration.

Signed-off-by: Jerome Luckenbach <github@luckenba.ch>

* Apply changes to current linting rules.

Signed-off-by: Jerome Luckenbach <github@luckenba.ch>

Signed-off-by: Jerome Luckenbach <github@luckenba.ch>

issue.title: [paradoxalarm] Handle multiple panels
issue.body:
Fixes #13640

Handle multiple panels (fixes #13640)

With this patch worked with 2 pannels connected but should work with unlimited number of panels.

P.S.: @theater I asigned to myself, you did enough already! :wink:

-->

issue.title: [paradoxalarm] Handle multiple panels
issue.body:
Fixes #13640

Handle multiple panels (fixes #13640)

With this patch worked with 2 pannels connected but should work with unlimited number of panels.

P.S.: @theater I asigned to myself, you did enough already! :wink:
